hero.title: I build Notion systems and n8n automations so your team can work with clarity and less friction.

process.title: How It Works
process.subtitle: A clear, structured process from initial audit to full implementation.

step1.title: Operational diagnosis
step1.description: We map your current processes; tools and recurring problems. The goal is to see how work really flows today; not how it is supposed to work on paper.

step2.title: System architecture
step2.description: We design how your business should run as a system; where information lives; how tasks move; what gets automated and what leadership needs to see every day.

step3.title: Build and automation
step3.description: We turn the architecture into real Notion workspaces and n8n workflows; shipped in small slices you can test with real work; not demo data.

step4.title: Rollout and support
step4.description: We roll out the system with your team; refine what does not feel natural and stay close during the first weeks so adoption is smooth and the system sticks.

clients.title: Trusted by Leading Teams
clients.subtitle: Organizations that transformed their operations with custom systems and automation.

items.quote: Beyker was excellent to work with. He completed a thorough review of our Notion setup and database templates, delivering clear insights and practical recommendations. His communication was professional and responsive throughout the engagement, and he met all project milestones on time. His expertise in Notion and no-code systems was evident in the quality of his work. He approached the assignment with attention to detail and a genuine understanding of our organizational needs. Highly recommended.
items.author: Vincent Socci

items.quote: I can't express how much relief Beyker's system has brought me. Before, I was juggling everything manually—tracking clients, sessions, and payments in notebooks. It was overwhelming. Beyker designed a Notion workspace that simplified everything without losing functionality. The clean interface, the data visualizations, and the way information is organized have added tremendous value to how I run my coaching practice. Now I can easily see my workload, track my conversion funnel, and understand my business metrics at a glance. This system has genuinely changed the way I work. I'm so excited to finally have something that helps me stay organized and efficient.
items.author: Inge Yang

items.quote: It is always a pleasure to meet with fellow technology enthusiasts who have the tools to help improve workflow within an organization and who understand the needs of today's market. At Tu Naranja Digital, we are committed to innovation and continuous improvement. When we began working with Beyker, we realized that we shared these values. We are very happy with the relationship we have. He is a valuable partner who helps us achieve our goals. I would highly recommend Beyker to any company looking to improve its technology and processes.
items.author: Alvaro Diaz

question1.q: What's the difference between a one-time project and a retainer?
question1.a: One-time projects have a defined scope and end date. Retainers provide ongoing support, iteration, and optimization of your systems.

question2.q: Do you work with n8n, Zapier, or Make?
question2.a: Yes, all three. I choose the best platform based on your needs, technical requirements, and budget.

question3.a: Timelines vary by scope. A Business OS typically takes 6-8 weeks. Smaller automation projects can be completed in 2-3 weeks.

faqPage.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faqPage.subtitle: Everything you need to know about working together, from process to pricing.

questions.question: What types of businesses do you work with?
questions.answer: I work with growing teams, agencies, and startups across industries. Most clients are between 5-50 people and need systems to scale operations without proportional headcount growth.

questions.question: Do you work with clients remotely?
questions.answer: Yes, all projects are conducted remotely. Most clients are in the US and Europe, but I've worked with teams worldwide.

questions.question: How do I get started?
questions.answer: The best starting point is either a Systems Audit (if you're exploring options) or booking a call to discuss your specific needs. Both options help us determine the right approach.

questions.question: Do you only work in Notion?
questions.answer: Notion is my primary platform for Business Operating Systems, but I work with other tools when they're the right fit. The goal is choosing the best solution for your needs, not forcing everything into Notion.

questions.question: Can you migrate data from our current system into Notion?
questions.answer: Yes, data migration is typically included in Business OS projects. We assess your current data, clean it up, and migrate what's relevant to the new system.

questions.question: What if our team doesn't know how to use Notion?
questions.answer: Team training is included in all Notion projects. Most teams become comfortable within a week of daily use. Documentation and training videos are also provided.

questions.question: Which automation platform should I use: n8n, Zapier, or Make?
questions.answer: It depends on your technical capabilities, budget, and specific needs. n8n offers the most flexibility but requires some technical setup. Zapier is user-friendly with extensive integrations. Make is powerful and cost-effective for complex workflows. I help choose the right platform during scoping.

questions.question: Do I need technical skills to maintain automations?
questions.answer: No. All automations include documentation and are designed to be maintainable by non-technical users. Error notifications are set up so you know when something breaks.

questions.question: What happens if an automation breaks?
questions.answer: For one-time projects, basic support is included for 2-4 weeks post-launch. For ongoing needs, the Automation Ops Partner retainer provides monitoring and rapid fixes.

questions.question: What's the difference between a one-time project and a retainer?
questions.answer: One-time projects have a defined scope and deliverable. Retainers provide ongoing support, optimization, and new feature development. Retainers make sense when your systems need to evolve regularly.

questions.question: How long does implementation take?
questions.answer: Systems Audits: 1-2 weeks. Automation projects: 2-4 weeks. Business OS: 6-8 weeks. Timelines depend on project scope and your team's availability for feedback.

questions.question: Do you offer payment plans?
questions.answer: Yes, projects over $5,000 can be split into milestone-based payments. Retainers are billed monthly.

questions.question: What's included in post-launch support?
questions.answer: All projects include 2-4 weeks of post-launch support for bug fixes and minor adjustments. This ensures the system works as expected before handover.

questions.question: How does white-label work?
questions.answer: You sell services to your clients under your brand. I handle delivery behind the scenes. You maintain the client relationship and set your own pricing. I provide wholesale pricing with predictable costs.

questions.question: What's the minimum commitment for white-label partnerships?
questions.answer: Minimum 2 projects per quarter to maintain the partnership. This ensures we build familiarity with your brand and delivery standards.

questions.question: Can you help with sales and scoping?
questions.answer: Yes, I provide sales support including scoping assistance, proposal templates, and pricing guidance to help you close deals.

questions.question: Will our team be able to maintain the system after you're done?
questions.answer: Yes. All projects include training and documentation designed for non-technical users. Systems are built to be maintained by your team, not dependent on me.

questions.question: What if we need changes after the project is complete?
questions.answer: Minor changes are covered during the support period. For ongoing needs, you can book ad-hoc hours or establish a retainer. Many clients start with a one-time project and move to a retainer as needs evolve.

questions.question: Do you provide ongoing support after handover?
questions.answer: Ongoing support is available through retainer agreements (Notion Architect or Automation Ops Partner). Ad-hoc support can also be purchased as needed.

cta.title: Still Have Questions?

notionRetainer.title: Notion Architect Retainer
notionRetainer.subtitle: Ongoing Notion system design, optimization, and team support to keep your workspace running smoothly.
whoThisIsFor: Teams with evolving workflows that need regular system updates
Growing companies that need expert support as they scale
Organizations wanting to maximize their Notion investment
monthlyActivities: New database and view creation as needs evolve

howItWorks.paragraph1: You get a dedicated monthly allocation of design hours. Use them for new features, optimizations, training, or troubleshooting. Unused hours don't roll over, ensuring you maximize value each month.
howItWorks.paragraph2: We meet monthly to review priorities and plan upcoming work. Communication happens async via Slack or your preferred tool.

outcomes: Notion workspace that evolves with your business
Fast resolution of system issues
Team confidence using the system
Ongoing optimization and improvements

outcomes: Reliable automation infrastructure
